result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryon R Hrin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

**CORRECTED 8-4-2016:  Once extended supervision is complete, defendant is exempt for Sex Offender Registry Program. **   

***AMENDED 07-19-2017:  The Court determined at the time of sentencing on June 4, 2016 that the defendant is exempted from lifetime registration pursuant to Wis. Stat. 301.45(1m)(bm). ***

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must register with Sex Offender Registry Program during extended supervision and follow all rules and regulations of same.  Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. No contact, directly or indirectly, with persons under the age of 18 without agent approval.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

1:59 PM  Attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryon R Hrin in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson  in court for Bryon R Hrin.  Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. 

Defense - Asking for clarification on the JOC as regards to extended supervision. 
State - State objects, believes that under the Stat. that the JOC is clear that he needs to be on the sex offender registry until successful completion of extended supervision. 



BTC: Motion to modify is denied. 
Court back on the record. 
Court asks is in compliance with Chapter 950. 
State indicates they are not compliant.  Parties are in agreement Chapter 950 doesn't apply to this hearing.

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant Bryon R Hrin in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Defendant Bryon R Hrin in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence.

Atty Kurzynski provided a copy of a letter from the defendant which wasn't provided to the court at sentencing.  (Exhibit 1)  He feels the character and needs of the defendant should be reconsidered.

State disagrees - no new factor.  Expungement cannot be granted.

BTC:  The court had numerous reports and letters from relatives and co-workers at the time of sentencing and were considered.  No new factor.  Motion denied.  Order signed.
